revised_title: The Demarcation Current and Longitudinal Resistance of Mammalian Nerve
tldr: The authors investigate the demarcation current and longitudinal resistance of mammalian nerve, discovering that the closure of an outer circuit affects the potential differences in the nerve and that the demarcation current can be traced in the longitudinal axis. They also find that the maximum E.M.F. decreases over time after the nerve is removed from the animal but can be restored by placing the nerve in tap water.
